comments:
Prior to sending requests to a servlet, the debug output 
reads : "java.net.UnknownServiceException: protocol doesn't support output"

My code (applet) works fine under NetBeans, and executes properly in the web 
browser (no such error in the java console).

I have no clue from where this could come from ?

Thanks in advance
Servlet protocol is HTTP on TCP/IP layer (no SSL encryption)
Vincent: Can you provide a small test case ?

Created an attachment (id=8211)
Testcase #1 for bugreport 53138

Eclipse Team Project set provided as a testcase for bugreport 53138.

Main class is FlightsBooking.java (executes as an applet).
ServeurSocket.java is the servlet.

To reproduce the error (protocol doesn't support output), simply launch the
applet (no need to launch the servlet). Then click on the "Rechercher" button
(jButton1) on the right bottom of the window.
You will see some debug information printed to the console and a SQL request
sent to the servlet. At this moment, the error will be printed to the Eclipse
console.

Feel free to ask me any questions. I hope that this test case will enable you
to diagnose the problem.

Yours, Vincent MICHEL
Your attachment is just an empty XML file. :-)
